Not Implemented: Journal encourages citation of data, code and materials or says nothing
Level I: Journal describes citation of data in guidelines to authors with clear rules and examples
Level II: Article provides appropriate citation for data and materials used consistent with journal’s author guidelines
Level III: Article is not published until providing appropriate citation for data and materials following journal’s author guidelines

Not Implemented: Journal encourages data sharing or says nothing
Level I: Article states whether data are available and, if so, where to access them
Level II: Data must be posted to a trusted repository. Exceptions must be identified at article submission
Level III: Data must be posted to a trusted repository, and reported analyses will be reproduced independently prior to publication

Not Implemented: Journal encourages code sharing or says nothing
Level I: Article states whether code is available and, if so, where to access it
Level II: Code must be posted to a trusted repository. Exceptions must be identified at article submission
Level III: Code must be posted to a trusted repository, and reported analyses will be reproduced independently prior to publication

Not Implemented: Journal encourages materials sharing or says nothing
Level I: Article states whether materials are available and, if so, where to access them
Level II: Materials must be posted to a trusted repository. Exceptions must be identified at article submission
Level III: Materials must be posted to a trusted repository, and reported analyses will be reproduced independently prior to publication

Not Implemented: Journal encourages design and analysis transparency or says nothing
Level II: Journal requires adherence to design transparency standards for review and publication
Level III: Journal requires and enforces adherence to design transparency standards for review and publication

Level I: Article states whether preregistration of study exists and, if so, where to access it
Level II: Article states whether preregistration of study exists and, if so, allows journal access during peer review for verification
Level III: Journal requires preregistration of studies and provides link and badge in article to meeting requirements

Level I: Article states whether preregistration of study exists and, if so, where to access it
Level II: Article states whether preregistration with analysis plan exists and, if so, allows journal access during peer review for verification
Level III: Journal requires preregistration of studies with analysis plans and provides link and badge in article to meeting requirements

Not Implemented: Journal discourages submission of replication studies or says nothing
Level I: Journal encourages submission of replication studies
Level II: Journal encourages submission of replication studies and conducts results blind review
Level III: Journal uses registered reports as a submission option for replication studies with peer review prior to observing the study outcomes
